Class Art

java.lang.Object
  gameutils.Art

public class Art
extends Object

A class that stores Images.

Author:
Roi Atalla

Nested Class Summary
 class Art.Loader
          A convenience class that buffers images and loads them all at once.

Method Detail

getFileName

public static String getFileName(String file)
Returns the canonical name of this file path. It strips the path and the extension.

Parameters:
file - The file to be canonicalized.
Returns:
The canonical name of this file.

add

public Image add(String file)
This method searches the root directory for the file path. Then it obtains the image by using javax.imageio.ImageIO. Its associated name is its canonical name.

Parameters:
filename - The file name of the image. Automatically creates a compatible image.
Returns:
The Image itself.
Throws:
Exception

add

public Image add(String file,
                 String name)
This method searches the root directory for the file path. Then it obtains the image by using javax.imageio.ImageIO.

Parameters:
filename - The file name of the image. Automatically creates a compatible image.
name - The name to associate with this image.
Returns:
The Image imported.
Throws:
Exception

add

public Image add(URL url,
                 String name)
Obtains the image using javax.imageio.ImageIO and adds it the map.

Parameters:
url - The URL to the image. Automatically creates a compatible image.
name - The name of the image.
Returns:
The Image itself.
Throws:
Exception

add

public Image add(Image image,
                 String name)
Adds the image to the map.

Parameters:
image - The image to be added. Automatically creates a compatible version of it.
name - The name of the image.
Returns:
The Image itself.

get

public Image get(String name)
Returns an image with the specified name.

Parameters:
name - The name of the image.
Returns:
The image associated with this name, if not found, returns null.

getName

public String getName(Image image)
Returns the name associated with this image.

Parameters:
image - The image who's associated name is returned.
Returns:
The name of the associated image. If it is not found, null is returned.

rename

public void rename(String oldName,
                   String newName)
Renames the image with a new name.

Parameters:
oldName - The image name to be renamed.
newName - The new named to be used.

replace

public Image replace(String oldName,
                     Image newImage)
Does the same thing as add(Image,String) except it ensures that the image is replaced since add(Image,String) is unreliable due to String's internalization mechanism.

Parameters:
oldName - The name of the previous image.
newImage - The new image.
Returns:
The old image.

swap

public void swap(String first,
                 String second)
Swaps the images associated with both strings.

Parameters:
first - The name of the first image.
second - The name of the second image.

remove

public Image remove(String name)
Removes the specified image name.

Parameters:
name - The name of the image to be removed.
Returns:
The image associated with this name, if not found, returns null.

splitAndAdd

public Image[][] splitAndAdd(Image image,
                             int width,
                             int height)
Splits the image with the specified width and height of each quadrant and adds the pieces to the map.

Parameters:
image - The image to be split.
width - The width of each quadrant inside the image.
height - the height of each quadrant inside the image.
Returns:
The images split from the original image.

createCompatibleImage

public static BufferedImage createCompatibleImage(int width,
                                                  int height)
Returns a BufferedImage that is compatible with the current display settings. The transparency used is TRANSLUCENT.

Parameters:
width - The width of the image.
height - The height of the image.
Returns:
The compatible BufferedImage.

createCompatibleImage

public static BufferedImage createCompatibleImage(int width,
                                                  int height,
                                                  int translucency)
Returns a BufferedImage that is compatible with the current display settings.

Parameters:
width - The width of the image.
height - The height of the image.
translucency - the translucency of the image. It can be any integer from the java.awt.Transparency class.
Returns:
The compatible BufferedImage.

createCompatibleImage

public static BufferedImage createCompatibleImage(Image image)
Converts the specified image to one that is compatible with the current display settings. If it is an instance of BufferedImage, the BufferedImage's transparency is used, else the returned image will have a transparency of type TRANSLUCENT.

Parameters:
image - The image to be converted.
Returns:
The converted compatible BufferedImage.

createCompatibleImage

public static BufferedImage createCompatibleImage(Image image,
                                                  int transparency)
Converts the specified image to one that is compatible with the current display settings.

Parameters:
image - The image to be converted.
transparency - The transparency of the new image.
Returns:
The converted compatible BufferedImage.

mirror

public static Image mirror(Image image,
                           boolean horizontally)
Mirrors the image along the specified axis.

Parameters:
image - The image to be mirrored.
horizontally - The axis to mirror over. If true, it will mirror over the X-Axis, else it will mirror over the Y-Axis.
Returns:
The mirrored image.
